title: @Riot Are you going to turn Veigar's ult into a skillshot?
body:
The way you worded it hints at it. And you're also planning on getting rid of the enemy AP scaling too. 

1. If his ult becomes a skillshot, you need to increase the ratio.
2. If the enemy AP ratio is also removed, you need to increase the ap ratio more. More unreliability = more damage.
3. It has to be able to pass through minions (obviously)

I don't like the idea of his ult being a skillshot because of the whole Q situation but I could see situations where it'd be useful. Bursting someone from over walls but not being able to kill them because of current R's 650 range and such.

But yeah. I don't really care about his passive, though.

Also, may I ask, is he likely to still have a mana regeneration passive after the changes?

it was answered in the other thread that they're scrapping the passive because it didn't really feel important and since Veigar's spell mana costs are higher because of it. So Veigar might get a mana passive similar to Lissandra's or something entirely new

What? I'm confused. Veigar was remade and he's been awesome. He has one of the best basic abilities in the game IMO. Why remove an amazing basic ability? It was synergizing perfectly with his first ability to allow him to farm relentlessly. On top of removing his anti-mage ultimate enemy AP scaling, you're replacing the basic? It better be one hell of a basic and even if it is, I think he's going to be a weaker champ because otherwise he doesn't have an easy way to get a lot of AP early.

Currently my fool-proof way of gaining AP is get Doran's Shield and play as passively as possible...if I have to buy some heavy mana regeneration item, new Catalyst I guess...? ...then it's going to take a lot longer to start getting the extra AP.

I don't think they're talking about his Baleful Strike passive, but instead his Equilibrium passive (1.5% increased mana regen for every 1% missing). 
I feel his passive loses a large part of its purpose, not that your passive can no longer affect many of the items which have been critical for his build in the past.
If they do, for some insane reason, need his Q, then I might cry.

No, he needs Equilibrium or he doesn't have the necessary fuel to farm up AP in the early game. He's going to be stuck farming up only gold for some crazy new mana items now right? Then he can start farming AP hard. It's a huge nerf.

Equilibrium is far less effective without the scaling on the flat mana regen items. 
Now that you lose a huge part of mana regen in typical Veigar builds, his passive becomes far less useful. 
This really kills my personal gameplay, since I always start out trying to build enough mana to stay in lane and not lose abilities while bursting.

In my experience, mana regeneration on Veigar was a wasted item slot because his basic was good. If you were buying mana regeneration on Veigar, you were doing it wrong. All he needs is survival and AP. Nothing else matters. Granted I used to buy mana pool items(to scale with Equilibrium, the basic ability) but after I bought him I realized those don't do so much. Issue was that he'd be jumped and die without being able to spend all that mana unless he had a significant amount of peel, which is too much of a demand. Mana pool runes might be okay on him I suppose, but I don't own those. The survival could be armor, MR, and/or movement speed, usually combined with health whenever possible. MR is usually less attractive though since a lot of the time the targets you need MR against will have high AP anyway but this isn't always the case.
